text:
Svidrigaïlov laughed suddenly. 

“Why take offense?” he asked. 

Raskolnikov frowned. “You’re too adaptable.” 

“Is that a crime?” 

“Just curious.” 

“Hardly anything interests me,” Svidrigaïlov said dreamily. 

“I’m bored. I wanted to see your sister.” 

Raskolnikov studied him. “You seem strange.” 

“Don’t scowl! There’s something wrong with you.” 

Raskolnikov looked away, unease settling in.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Svidrigaïlov expresses his boredom and adaptability while observing Raskolnikov's strange demeanor.
